body: Say I declare a header file with a variable: int count; Then in the source file, I want to use `count`. Do I have to declare it as: extern int count Or can I just use it in my source file? All assuming that I have `#include "someheader.h"`. Or should I just declare it in the source file? What is the difference between putting count in the header file vs the source file? Or does it not matter?
title: Difference between putting variables in header vs putting variables in source
